sections.text: The M.Arch at Princeton’s School of Architecture prepares students for advanced architectural practice, emphasizing design innovation, history, theory, and building technology.

items: Courses in history and theory of architecture
sections.text: The three-year curriculum integrates design studios, history/theory, and technical training, culminating in a thesis project.

items: Bachelor’s degree in any field; prior architecture studies not required
sections.text: Admission requires a portfolio and evidence of creative ability; prior architectural study is not required.
Graduates pursue careers in architectural practice, urban design, research, and academia.
